收.definition: to receive; to accept; to collect; to put away; to restrain; to stop; in care of (used on address line after name)

收之桑榆.definition: see 失之東隅，收之桑榆|失之东隅，收之桑榆[shi1 zhi1 dong1 yu2 , shou1 zhi1 sang1 yu2]

收假.definition: (of holidays) to come to an end; end of a vacation

收入.definition: to take in; income; revenue; CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]

收兵.definition: to retreat; to withdraw troops; to recall troops; fig. to finish work; to wind up; to call it a day; used with negatives: the task is far from over

收割.definition: to harvest; to reap; to gather in crops

收口.definition: (knitting, basket weaving etc) to cast off; to bind; (of a wound) to close up; to heal

收回.definition: to regain; to retake; to take back; to withdraw; to revoke

收地.definition: to confiscate land for redistribution (China, 1947-52); (of a government) to acquire land (with compensation)

收報.definition: to receive mail; to receive a telegraph

收場.definition: the end; an ending; to wind down; to conclude

收存.definition: to receive for storage; delivery of goods; to gather and store; to store safely; safe keeping

收官.definition: final part of a go game (see 官子[guan1 zi3]); endgame; to finish up; to come to the final stage

收容.definition: to provide a place to stay; to house; to accommodate; (of an institution etc) to take in; to accept

收容所.definition: temporary shelter; hospice; refuge (e.g. for animals); detention center

收容教育.definition: custody and reeducation (administrative punishment for prostitutes)

收尾.definition: to wind up; to bring to an end; to finish

收尾音.definition: the final of a Korean syllable (consonant or consonant cluster at the end of the syllable)

收山.definition: (slang) (from Cantonese) to bow out after a long career; to pack it in; (of a gangster, prostitute etc) to get out of the game; (of a business) to cease to operate

收山之作.definition: the final work in the career of a composer, film director or architect etc

收工.definition: to stop work for the day (generally of laborers); to knock off

收市.definition: to close the market (for the day); to close (a market, shop etc) for business

收復.definition: to recover (lost territory etc); to recapture

收心.definition: to concentrate on the task; to curb one's evil instincts

收悉.definition: (literary) to receive and understand the contents of (a letter)

收押.definition: in custody; to keep sb in detention

收拾.definition: to put in order; to tidy up; to pack; to repair; (coll.) to sort sb out; to fix sb

收拾殘局.definition: to clear up the mess; to pick up the pieces

收攏.definition: to draw to oneself; to gather up; to collect; to fold up (an umbrella, wings etc); to assemble (a party of persons); to rope in (some people)

收攬.definition: to win the support of; to get over to one's side; to keep control of

收支.definition: cash flow; financial balance; income and expenditure

收支相抵.definition: to break even; balance between income and expenditure

收斂.definition: to dwindle; to vanish; to make vanish; to exercise restraint; to curb (one's mirth, arrogance etc); to astringe; (math.) to converge

收斂鋒芒.definition: to draw in one's claws; to show some modesty

收方.definition: receiving party; recipient; debit side (of balance sheet), as opposed to credit side 付方[fu4 fang1]

收旗卷傘.definition: lit. to furl up flags and umbrellas (idiom); fig. to stop what one is doing

收服.definition: to subdue; to force to capitulate; to reduce to submission; to soothe

收束.definition: to constrict; to draw tight; to gather (one's thoughts); to bring to a close; to pack (for a journey)

收款.definition: to receive payment; to collect money

收殘綴軼.definition: to gather and patch up sth that is badly damaged (idiom)

收獲.definition: variant of 收穫|收获[shou1 huo4]

收留.definition: to offer shelter; to have sb in one's care

收發.definition: to receive and send; to receive and transmit

收發室.definition: mail room; radio room (i.e. reception and transmission)

收監.definition: to imprison; to take into custody

收禮.definition: to accept a gift; to receive presents

收穫.definition: to harvest; to reap; to gain; crop; harvest; profit; gain; bonus; reward

收納.definition: to receive; to accept; to take in; to hold

收線.definition: to reel in (a fishing line etc); to hang up the phone

收編.definition: to incorporate into one's troops; to weave in

收縮.definition: to pull back; to shrink; to contract; (physiology) systole

收繳.definition: to recover (illegally obtained property); to seize; to capture; to force sb to hand over sth; to levy

收羅.definition: to gather (people); to collect (talent); to come to an end

收聲.definition: (Cantonese) to stop talking; to shut up

收腹.definition: to draw in one's belly; to tighten the abdominal muscles

收藏.definition: to collect (works of art, dolls, antiques etc); to put away for safekeeping; (Internet) to bookmark; a collection

收詞.definition: to collect words; to harvest entries for a dictionary

收買.definition: to purchase; to buy; to bribe; to buy off

收購.definition: to buy; to purchase; to procure

收錄.definition: to include (in a collection); to put together (stories, poems etc); to record; to employ; to recruit

收音.definition: to receive a radio signal; to make an audio recording; (of an auditorium etc) to have good acoustics; (vocal training, linguistics) ending (of a word or syllable)

收養.definition: to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc); to adopt (a child); adoption
